t: Job Says He Longs for God
“Even*pn today my complaint is rebellion; His*ln hand is heavy despite my groaning.
Oh*ln that I knew where I might find Him, That*ln I might come to His seat!
I*ln would present my*i case before Him And*ln fill my mouth with arguments.
I*ln would learn the words which*i He would answer, And*ln perceive what He would say to me.
Would*ln He contend with me by the greatness of His*i power? No,*ln surely He would pay attention to me.
There*ln the upright would reason with Him; And*ln I would be delivered forever from my Judge.
“Behold,*ln I go forward but He is not there,*i And*ln backward, but I cannot perceive Him;
When*ln He acts on the left, I cannot behold Him;*i He*ln turns on the right, I cannot see Him.
But*ln He knows the way I take; When*iln He has tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
My*ln foot has held fast to His path; I*ln have kept His way and not turned aside.
I*ln have not departed from the command of His lips; I*ln have treasured the words of His mouth more than my necessary food.
But*ln He is unique and who can turn Him? And*ln what*i His soul desires, that He does.
For*ln He performs what is appointed for me, And*ln many such decrees*i are with Him.
Therefore,*ln I would be dismayed at His presence; When*iln I consider, I am terrified of Him.
It*iln is*i God who*i has made my heart faint, And*ln the Almighty who*i has dismayed me,
But*ln I am not silenced by the darkness, Nor*ln deep gloom which*i covers me.
